intro: Silene laciniata var. greggii, commonly known as Gregg's filaree, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
